intro: Valeriana montana var. tarraconensis, commonly known as the Pyrenean valerian, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, often pinkish or white flowers. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Valeriana montana var. tarraconensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
